47.heading: Franquin, André, 1924-1996--Miscellanea.
47.title: "The Angouleme Convention"
47.author: Dana Jennings
47.appears_in: p. 100 in The Comics Journal, no. 89 (Mar. 1984)
notes: Brief general description of the 1983 International Salon of Comic Books (held Jan. 28-30, 1983). The first Salon had 10,000 attendees in 1974. Will Eisner won the "Grand Prize of the City of Angouleme" for lifetime achievement in 1975, and that Jean Giraud, Reiser, Franquin and Paul Gillon are previous winners.

notes: Summary: Presents the life of Jesus Christ in forty-five brief stories illustrated with comic strips.

136.title: "Fraser Short on Laughs, Charm as 'Do Right'"

137.heading: Frasier.
137.title: "Children of the Night"
137.author: Griffy.
notes: Summary: Bert and Bob talk in an empty diner about television: Sipowicz, teletubbies, and that dog on Frasier.

139.title: Franquin, André, 1924-1996
notes: Belgian comics artist, winner of the grand prize at the first Angoulême Festival in 1974. See also his Idées Noires.
